abstract.text: Presents a view controller modally.

inlineContent.text: The view controller to display over the current view controllerâ€™s content.
to animate the presentation; otherwise, pass
The block to execute after the presentation finishes. This block has no return value and takes no parameters. You may specify
In a horizontally regular environment, the view controller is presented in the style specified by the

property. In a horizontally compact environment, the view controller is presented full screen by default. If you associate an adaptive delegate with the presentation controller associated with the object in
, you can modify the presentation style dynamically.

The object on which you call this method may not always be the one that handles the presentation. Each presentation style has different rules governing its behavior. For example, a full-screen presentation must be made by a view controller that itself covers the entire screen. If the current view controller is unable to fulfill a request, it forwards the request up the view controller hierarchy to its nearest parent, which can then handle or forward the request.

Before displaying the view controller, this method resizes the presented view controllerâ€™s view based on the presentation style. For most presentation styles, the resulting view is then animated onscreen using the transition style in the

property of the presented view controller. For custom presentations, the view is animated onscreen using the presented view controllerâ€™s transitioning delegate. For current context presentations, the view may be animated onscreen using the current view controllerâ€™s transition style.
The completion handler is called after the
method is called on the presented view controller.

A true value.

An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether this view controllerâ€™s view is covered when the view controller or one of its descendants presents a view controller.
Returns a Boolean indicating whether the current input view is dismissed automatically when changing controls.
Dismisses the view controller that was presented modally by the view controller.
A Boolean value indicating whether the view controller enforces a modal behavior.
The presentation style for modal view controllers.
The transition style to use when presenting the view controller.
Presents a view controller modally.
The view controller that is presented by this view controller, or one of its ancestors in the view controller hierarchy.
The view controller that presented this view controller.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view controller specifies the transition style for view controllers it presents.
Presents a view controller in a primary context.
Posted when a split view controller is expanded or collapsed.
Presents a view controller in a secondary (or detail) context.
Notifies the view controller that its view was added to a view hierarchy.
